Configuration File¶

A configuration file is a yaml file defined following LightningCLI specifics. It is used to define each hyperparameter needed to drive the modular network definition, training and evaluation and the dataset management

Some example configuration files are stored in the /default_configurations folder on github

Trainer Parameters¶

LightningCLI supports the parametrization of a Trainer object through a yaml configuration file

The trainer parameters are defined under the yaml key trainer

For example:

trainer:
    gpus: 1
    limit_train_batches: .1
    max_epochs : 5
    ...

Default trainer parameters can be shown using python trainer.py fit --print-config, see LightningCLI

General Parameters¶

Under /default_configurations files you cane notice that some parameters are given to LightningCLI without indentation. For this project, the useful LightningCLI parameters are:

seed_everything
set the global seed in the python runtime (torch, cuda and numpy)

Expected Modules and Parameters¶

Each expected module has parameters; in the yaml configuration file expected module parameters are organized under a key

Here is reported the list expected modules together with each key:

DatasetManager
key: dataset_manager
